trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator"></xref> control.
This class cannot be inherited.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs> is passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate> event handler to provide event data to the handler.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate> event is raised when validation is performed on the server.

This allows you to perform a custom server-side validation routine on the value of an input control (with a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator> control associated with it) in the event handler.
The value to validate is determined by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.Value%2A> property.
Once your code has determined whether the value is valid, store the results of the validation in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.IsValid%2A> property.

For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs>.
Property
Initial Value
The value of the `value` parameter.
The value of the `isValid` parameter.
The value to validate.
`true` to indicate that the value passes validation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets whether the value specified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.Value"></xref> property passed validation.

Once your validation routine finishes, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.IsValid%2A> property to indicate whether the value specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.Value%2A> property passed validation.
This value determines whether the input control associated with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator> control passed validation.
`true` to indicate that the value specified by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.Value"></xref> property passed validation; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the value to validate in the custom event handler for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate"></xref> event.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ServerValidateEventArgs.Value%2A> property determine the value to validate in the custom event handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate> event.
Notice that you cannot programmatically change this value.
The value to validate in the custom event handler for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.CustomValidator.ServerValidate"></xref> event.
